intro: Helianthus tracheliifolius, commonly known as the roughleaf sunflower, is a species native to the eastern and central United States. It is a herbaceous plant that typically grows to a height of 1 to 3 meters, featuring large, daisy-like yellow flowers with a dark center. The leaves are usually rough and hairy, with a distinctive trichome-covered surface. It produces numerous seeds in its composite flower head, which are dispersed by wind. This plant thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, often found in open fields and along roadsides.
